intro: Epidendrum violascens, commonly known as the violet orchid, is a species of orchid native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its striking violet to purple flower spikes that often have a velvety texture. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees and other structures in its natural habitat. Its leaves are usually dark green and革质 (leathery), providing a contrast to the vivid flowers. Epidendrum violascens is valued in horticulture for its ornamental beauty and relatively easy care requirements.
